rows.heading: How menstrual cycles impact young people
rows.description:
Menstruation can cause disruption to daily life if it is not well managed. Particularly painful phases that adolescents go through can have an impact on their school attendance and performance.
Girls leave school due to a variety of factors, including inadequate resources and facilities, restrictions on girls' mobility during their periods, and feelings of shame or being "unclean."
Menstruation-related taboos, misconceptions, and shame can cause teasing, humiliation, exclusion from social activities, and other problems that are detrimental to girls' feelings of dignity.

rows.heading: Key areas to improve menstrual health
Social support
rows.description: Social support is an interchange of resources between at least two people that the giver or recipient believes is meant to improve the recipient's health.

rows.heading: Access to absorbent materials and supportive supplies.
rows.description:
In addition to materials, women and girls require access to private and secure areas where they can change their menstrual products, wash any reusable dry products, and wash their bodies with soap and water.
Washrooms and supplementary infrastructure are therefore crucial enablers.
